title: everywhere i've lived
name: everywhere i've lived
description:
A Map by Lizzielou

we moved a lot when i was little.  look at all the towns i've lived in!

properties.name: addendum
properties.description: Posted by Lizzielouupdate from my mom on the brief spell we spent in appalachia, when i was a baby: "Prestonsburg was the town where Dad worked. We actually lived in Cliff at first, as I recall..just outside of Prestonsburg. When we moved to the apartment (to get away from the slugs), we moved into "town" (Prestonsburg) I think we called the whole area Prestonsburg."

properties.name: back to baltimore
properties.description: Posted by Lizzielouit was great to be back in baltimore after our time in mechanicsburg. we ended up being here about eight years, and both of our kids were born here. it never felt like the place we would end up, somehow, but we have a really strong connection to it.

properties.name: back to kansas
properties.description: Posted by Lizzielouwe moved back to kansas when i started kindergarten. i went to a school called "bonjour elementary," and you don\'t pronounce that with a french accent.

properties.name: baltimore
properties.description: Posted by Lizzielouafter we graduated, m and i moved in with my family outside of baltimore. he worked and i went to grad school in college park, and then we had baby bean!

properties.name: birthplace of me
properties.description: Posted by Lizzieloulawrence, ksi was born here, and i went back to finish college and meet the love of my life.

properties.name: chicago
properties.description: Posted by Lizzieloui always say i lived in chicago, but to be perfectly honest, i lived in mundelein. it looks worse than it sounds, know what i mean? i was in fourth and fifth grade there, and i lived on a street with a fabulous, suburban pack of kids. i skated in too-small ice skates until my toenails fell off one winter. the snow was so monumental there that we could hollow out drifts and make igloos. i had the world\'s best fourth grade teacher.

properties.name: college, part one
properties.description: Posted by Lizzieloui went to wellesley college for two years, and then i had a little mini-nervous breakdown and never went back.

properties.name: my hippie parents
properties.description: Posted by LizzielouÂ Davis, CAwe lived here for two years while my dad worked for ucdavis.

properties.name: south central pa
properties.description: Posted by Lizzieloui always thought it was funny when i would hear people refer to this part of pennsylvania as "south central." we were so bored living in mechanicsburg that we would often drive down to the mall in towson, md. that\'s pretty sad. m worked as a music buyer for a brand new book and music superstore, and we would hang out there drinking cappuccinos and letting bean taste the foam. bean met allen ginsberg at that book store. we lasted about a year and a half in pennsylvania.

properties.name: st louis
properties.description: Posted by Lizzieloui think the town was called chesterfield -- it was definitely in the western suburbs of st. louis. i moved in with my parents and my brother after my sophomore year of college to figure out what the heck to do next. i just lived with them for about nine months, lying on the couch and figuring out what to do. i took a writing class at washington university, and i managed to get my drivers license. i also spent a lot of time at denny\'s in the middle of the night with my 11 year-old brother. then i went back to college, this time to k.u. in lawrence.

properties.name: the farm house
properties.description: Posted by Lizzielouwe lived in a little rented farm house. our next door neighbor was also our milkman (this was the 1970\'s, but we had an actual milkman). we had a big pasture, a pond, and an old barn. today if you drove down the road we lived on, you\'d see several 20 year-old housing developments where our house was.

properties.name: today
properties.description: Posted by LizzielouPortland MEportland is where we are! it\'s so pretty on the map, right on the coast, with all of those crazy islands sprinkled alongside. it\'s pretty great in real life, too.

properties.name: where i'm from, kind of
properties.description: Posted by Lizzieloukatonah is more or less where i\'m actually from, so to speak. we moved there when i was in sixth grade, and i graduated from high school there. it was the longest we lived in one spot! it\'s strange to go back there -- i didn\'t learn to drive until i was 19, so when i drive around katonah, i feel like i\'m in trouble.
